ref: 9245 bíla1. 3. *vira -- 2: vīrī f. ʻ pit in river bed ʼ (← G. virṛī f. id).

9245 bíla1 n. ʻ cave, hole, pit, opening ʼ RV., billa -- n. ʻ hole, reservoir ʼ lex. 2. vila -- n. BhP. 3. *vira -- 2. [Variation of b -- and v -- and of -- l -- , -- ll -- , -- r -- and (if nibiḍá -- ʻ dense ʼ ~ virala -- ʻ sparse ʼ belongs or if, with basic mng. ʻ split ʼ conn. viḍa -- m. ʻ piece ʼ W., bila -- m.n. BHSk.) -- ḍ -- supports origin from Drav. word -- group DED 4459, T. Burrow BSOAS xii 388. Conn. bilati, bēlayati, vē˚ ʻ splits ʼ Dhātup.?]
Pk. bila -- n. ʻ cave, hole ʼ;
Pk. bila -- n. ʻ cave, hole ʼ;
Kho. bil ʻ opening, mouth of vessel, muzzle of gun ʼ, (ʻ lid of vessel ʼ poss. < *bila -- 2), (Lor.) bilóg ʻ niche, recess, hole in wall ʼ;
Sh. (Lor.) bil ʻ opening, hole in roof, mouth (of vessel, well or bag), edge (of precipice) ʼ;
S. ḇiru m. ʻ animal's hole or burrow ʼ;
Or. biḷa ʻ hole, deep pool formed by change of river course ʼ, biḷā ʻ hole, anthill ʼ;
H. bil, bilā ʻ hole of mouse or rat ʼ;
M. bīḷ n. ʻ hole (of snake, rat, &c.), den (of tiger, &c.) ʼ;
Si. bala ʻ cave, hole ʼ, bila ʻ cave ʼ, bilē ʻ hollow in tree -- trunk ʼ.
